Posts.Content: Trisha_G wrote: I am 27yrs old and have recently found a lump in my left breast. My Great grandmother, grandmother, and Aunt have all had bc. Leaving me as the only female family member who has not.  I went for an ultrasound of the lump but it came back negative for anything at all. I know its there I can feel it, and so can my Dr.  I have made a follow up app. at a the university of Penn. for July 1st. If stress could kill I would be dead by then! I am so afraid! My Dr. is taking a very laid back wait and see type approach that is making me even more crazy! How did all of you get through this "waiting period" and what should expect from my first app. w/ the bs? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scared.... Trisha_G leaf

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2009 03:08PM Trisha_G wrote: Msaylor, I am currently going through the same thing and scared to death! I found a lump went to the DR. who could also very easily find it..... I went for my ultrasound that came back negative! ahhh! How is that even possible!!! Its certainly a lump and is easily found by anyone willing to feel it! So I am lucky enough to have great insurance and I am able to get a second opinion w/o needing a referal. I am also lucky to live near several great University hospitals! I just got my July 1st app. bumped up to tomorrow, I am crawling out of my skin I am so nervous!!!!!! I am part relieved to just get the app. over with but mostly just freaking out about the unknown! I would recommend to anyone going through this to get a 2nd opinion if you can.  Its your body not the Dr.'s and you are the one unable to put your mind at ease about it!  I believe a womans gut feeling is not something to be ignored!!! God bless you! Trisha
Posts.Title: Tired of waiting.... msaylor Beesie

Posts.Content: May 28, 2009 09:23PM Trisha_G wrote: Butterfly, I know it seems hard but you should keep your mom in the loop. You need someone you can go to in this very hard time. Trust me im sure she knows something is wrong, moms always do! Let her be there for you in the way mothers are meant to! Good Luck and God bless! Trisha
